nodes.text: Speeder tag was a recreational activity in which players were mounted on speeder bikes and wielded energy slingshots. The object of the game was to score points by triggering the sensors strapped to the opponent's backs with harmless energy pellets. The cartographers Auric and Rhyssa Graf used to play that game with their children Milo and Lina, which they notably did in the termite forests of Indoumodo.
